channel.title: Jarring and signing
channel.description: can anyone please help me with jarring my client cause when i try to do it it says my windows is not compatable with my version of windows if anyone uses any other program besides jarmaker please post jar maker you use for your windows 8 please and thank you

item.title: Jarring and signing
item.dc:creator: @ExtremeX-Scape Ryley
item.description:
@ExtremeX-Scape wrote:

Every Java IDE comes with a tool to export Java archives and you can create a JAR from the command line.

Signing is a different story, since the recent Java update applets cannot be run unless their signatures are verified, getting one of these verified certs costs money. You can, however by pass this by self-signing and changing your Javaâ€™s security settings to medium which would allow self signed applets to run.

Read full topic

item.title: Jarring and signing
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

You technically do not need to use Jar maker to jar a program.
You can use command line arguments to get the same functionality, JARMaker just makes it easier.

http://docs.oracle.com/javase/tutorial/deployment/jar/build.html

Read full topic
